title: Swamp Trickster - Murk / Maurr / Rilk
description: Encounter module for the duplicitous swamp informant, with TONE effects, REMNANTS profile, and branching true/false hideout paths.

passages.name: swamp_intro
passages.text:
You step into a patch of waist-deep fog. A dim lantern bobbing in the mist reveals a hunched figure under a mossy cloak. He tilts his head without asking a name.

“Name?” he rasps. “Names float. Truth sinks. What you call it dont change the swamp, stranger.”

choices.text: “Uh... yeah. Well you could say so.”
“Why? Are you a guide or something?”
choices.note: Probing, assertive; makes him cagey but intrigued.

choices.text: “Mom said careful of strangers. Whats your name?”
“Im looking for a man I heard is around these parts.”
choices.note: Direct, may corner him; he becomes evasive and playful.

passages.name: second_encounter
passages.text:
He snorts, as if offended and entertained at once. “Oi there, dont spose you member me?” He shifts the lantern so it catches the moss along his cloak.

He offers a name without commitment: ‘Maurr.’

choices.text: “Murk was it?”
choices.note: Tone-sensitive breadcrumb outcome is resolved in 'breadcrumb_result'.

choices.text: “Why are you changing names?”
choices.note: Narrative pressure; can open hidden branch if N >= 2.

choices.text: “Ive got a fragment you wanted.”
choices.note: Offer as currency; may buy truth depending on alignment.

passages.name: breadcrumb_result
passages.text: He laughs and rubs his palms. “Thats a might nice one. Talk to Kaelen, hell set you straight. Tell 'im Charl sent ya.”
passages.note: Whether this breadcrumb is useful depends on TONE and player alignment.

outcome.message: He gives you a straightforward breadcrumb; Kaelen is trustworthy for you.
You notice the lantern fidgets when he says 'Charl' — something misaligned.
Your pressure forces a reveal; a hidden dialogue branch opens.
He softens; offers a partial truth that points generally in the right direction.
You leave with a name. Later you learn it points to a false hideout.

passages.name: lantern_clue
passages.text: Your eye catches the lanterns flame — a microflicker out of step with his words. The moss on his cloak points subtly the opposite way to where he gestures.

choices.text: Follow the moss direction
choices.note: Observation clue leads to true path.

choices.text: Trust his words and head the other way
choices.note: Ignoring the clue can make you lose time in a swamp maze.

passages.name: challenge_branch
passages.text: Under your steady stare he blinks. For a second a real name slips and then is gone. He coughs. “Names… are for the living, lad. But if youre insistent—try the broken edifice, east of the collapsed rail.”

choices.text: Press for a clearer location
Note the half-truth and leave

passages.name: partial_truth
passages.text:
He leans in, for a heartbeat almost real. “Theres a place where the water remembers the shape of stone—thatd be a good place to start.”

Its not a map, but its something.

choices.text: Follow the poetic clue
Keep searching for clearer leads

passages.name: false_breadcrumb
passages.text: You follow his directions to a ruined hideout. Its full of rusted tools and men who swear they know Drossels name, but none of them have the right seals. Youre sent in circles, time is lost, and the swamp seems to close around you.

choices.text: Push through the maze (time-consuming)
Return and interrogate the trickster again

passages.name: true_breadcrumb
passages.text: The direction leads you to a half-submerged gate, overgrown, with a faint sigil under the muck that matches glyph fragments youve seen. This is real. The air tastes like old bargains.

choices.text: Follow this lead toward Drossels hideout
Mark the place and gather more information

passages.name: maze_sidequest
passages.text: Lost among reed and muck, you find a forgotten shrine and a minor glyph. Its a detour, but the swamp rewards persistence.

choices.text: Take the glyph and head back to the swamp edge
Explore deeper

passages.name: drossel_approach
passages.text: You advance toward Drossels area, marked by secret sigils and guarded whispers. The tricksters information saved you time and bought you one step closer to the five glyphs he hinted at.

choices.text: Press the advantage and seek Drossel now
Observe first and learn the guard patterns

integration_notes: This JSON can be consumed by the StoryBuilder or parsed into Twine passages. Each passage includes 'tone_effects' (applied on choice) and 'tone_checks' (to route to gated outcomes). REMNANTS profile is included for NPC manager integration. To integrate with story_definitions.py: call story.add_passage for each passage and story.add_choice mapping the tone_effects and tone_checks as conditional branching.
